planeCompose.title: Plane for
planeCompose.description: Introducing <1>Plane Compose</1>, the implementation layer of Projects-as-Code. A model where a project's structure becomes a first-class artifact: defined in code, versioned in Git, and reviewed like any other change.
planeCompose.subtitle: Bring Git-style discipline to project management
planeCompose.subtitleDesc: Version your project configuration, review changes through PRs, and standardize structures across your organization.
planeCompose.feature1Desc: Initialize a project scaffold instantly with CLI
planeCompose.feature2Desc: Define workflows, states, labels, types & custom fields as code
planeCompose.feature3Desc: plane schema pull/push & plane pull/push for seamless sync
planeCompose.feature4Desc: Clone and replicate project structure across workspaces

whyPlane.title: Why Teams Choose
whyPlane.description: Plane is the open-source project management platform that gives you everything you need to plan, track, and ship.
whyPlane.projectsDesc: Customizable workflows, dependency tracking, and flexible boards to manage any project type.
whyPlane.wikiDesc: Built-in documentation with rich text editor and publishable pages for your team's knowledge base.
whyPlane.aiDesc: Automate routine tasks and gain insights across projects with intelligent automation.
whyPlane.deploymentDesc: Cloud, Self-hosted, or Airgapped options to meet your security and compliance requirements.

blog.title: Blog
blog.heroDesc: Insights, guides, and best practices on project management, Plane, and digital transformation.

posts.title: Why Migrate from Jira to Plane in 2025
posts.excerpt: Discover the key advantages of switching from Jira to Plane and how to make the transition seamless.
posts.author: PALANTIR-CODE
posts.content:
Many organizations are rethinking their project management tools in 2025. Jira, while powerful, has grown increasingly complex and expensive. Plane offers a modern, open-source alternative that combines simplicity with enterprise-grade features.

One of the biggest advantages of Plane is its intuitive interface. Teams can get started quickly without the steep learning curve that Jira is known for. The unified workspace brings together project tracking, documentation, and collaboration in one place.

Plane also offers flexible deployment options: cloud, self-hosted, or airgapped. This means your data stays where you want it, meeting even the strictest compliance requirements.

At PALANTIR-CODE, we've helped dozens of teams make the switch. Our migration process ensures zero data loss, complete field mapping, and comprehensive user training. The result? Teams that are more productive from day one.

posts.title: Plane Compose: Projects-as-Code Revolution
posts.excerpt: Learn how Plane Compose brings Git-style discipline to project management with version-controlled configurations.
posts.author: PALANTIR-CODE
posts.content:
Plane Compose introduces a groundbreaking concept: Projects-as-Code. Just as Infrastructure-as-Code transformed how we manage servers, Plane Compose transforms how we manage projects.

With Plane Compose, your project structure becomes a first-class artifact. Workflows, states, labels, and custom fields are defined in YAML, versioned in Git, and reviewed through pull requests.

The CLI makes it simple: 'plane init' scaffolds a new project, 'plane schema pull' syncs your configuration, and 'plane clone' replicates structures across workspaces.

This approach brings consistency across teams, reduces onboarding time, and enables DevOps teams to manage project infrastructure with the same rigor they apply to code. At PALANTIR-CODE, we help teams adopt Plane Compose and integrate it into their existing CI/CD pipelines.

posts.title: Project Management Best Practices for 2025
posts.excerpt: Stay ahead with the latest trends and best practices in project management for high-performing teams.
posts.author: PALANTIR-CODE
posts.content:
Project management is evolving rapidly. In 2025, the most successful teams are embracing new approaches that prioritize flexibility, transparency, and automation.

First, open-source tools are gaining traction. Organizations want transparency in their tools, not just their processes. Plane exemplifies this trend with its fully open-source codebase.

Second, AI-powered automation is becoming essential. From auto-assigning tasks to generating project insights, AI is helping teams focus on what matters most.

Third, unified workspaces are replacing fragmented toolchains. Instead of switching between project tracking, documentation, and communication tools, teams want everything in one place.

Finally, compliance and data sovereignty are top priorities. Self-hosted and airgapped deployment options ensure that sensitive project data stays within organizational boundaries.

At PALANTIR-CODE, we help organizations adopt these best practices with Plane as the foundation.
